name: Taj Mahal
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and symbol of love, built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

name: Great Wall of China
description: One of the world's most iconic structures, stretching over 13,000 miles across northern China.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: An iconic iron lattice tower built in 1889, symbol of Paris and France.

name: Colosseum
description: Ancient amphitheater in Rome, once home to gladiator contests and Roman spectacles.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: A gift from France to the USA, symbolizing freedom and democracy.

name: Machu Picchu
description: A 15th-century Inca citadel set high in the Andes Mountains.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: A giant Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ, overlooking Rio de Janeiro.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: Famous performing arts center with unique sail-like architecture.

name: Pyramids of Giza
description: Ancient pyramids and tombs of Egyptian pharaohs, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu.

name: Burj Khalifa
description: The world's tallest building, standing at 828 meters in Dubai.

name: Angkor Wat
description: The largest religious monument in the world, built in the 12th century.

name: Mount Fuji
description: Japan's tallest peak and an active volcano, sacred in Japanese culture.

name: Santorini
description: A picturesque Greek island known for whitewashed houses and blue-domed churches.

name: Niagara Falls
description: Massive waterfalls straddling the US-Canada border, attracting millions of visitors.

name: Banff National Park
description: Canada’s first national park, famous for turquoise lakes and mountain scenery.

name: Petra
description: An ancient city carved into rose-red cliffs, known as the 'Rose City'.

name: Grand Canyon
description: A massive canyon carved by the Colorado River, known for breathtaking views.

name: Serengeti National Park
description: A wildlife sanctuary famous for the Great Migration of wildebeest and zebras.

name: Table Mountain
description: A flat-topped mountain offering panoramic views of Cape Town.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument of standing stones, shrouded in mystery.

name: Acropolis of Athens
description: An ancient citadel containing the Parthenon, a masterpiece of classical Greek architecture.

name: Chichen Itza
description: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya people, home to the Temple of Kukulcán.

name: Dubai Marina
description: A man-made canal city with modern skyscrapers, luxury yachts, and vibrant nightlife.

name: Great Barrier Reef
description: The world's largest coral reef system, visible from space, rich in marine biodiversity.

name: Iguazu Falls
description: One of the largest and most impressive waterfall systems in the world.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: A masterpiece of Byzantine architecture, once a church, then a mosque, now a museum.

name: Mount Everest Base Camp
description: A popular trekking destination offering views of the world’s highest mountain.

name: Mount Kilimanjaro
description: Africa’s tallest mountain and a popular climbing destination.

name: Sagrada Familia
description: An unfinished basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí, blending Gothic and Art Nouveau styles.

name: Times Square
description: A bustling commercial hub known for neon lights, Broadway shows, and New Year’s Eve celebrations.

name: Yellowstone National Park
description: The first national park in the world, known for geysers, hot springs, and wildlife.

name: Alhambra
description: A palace and fortress complex showcasing Islamic architecture and gardens.

name: Blue Lagoon
description: A geothermal spa with milky-blue waters, surrounded by lava fields.

name: Cinque Terre
description: A coastal area of five colorful fishing villages on the Italian Riviera.

name: Salar de Uyuni
description: The world’s largest salt flat, creating a mirror effect after rainfall.

name: Galápagos Islands
description: An archipelago known for unique wildlife and inspiration for Darwin’s theory of evolution.

name: Victoria Falls
description: One of the world’s largest waterfalls, locally known as 'The Smoke That Thunders'.

name: Bagan Temples
description: An ancient city with over 2,000 Buddhist temples, pagodas, and stupas.

name: Louvre Museum
description: The world’s largest art museum, home to the Mona Lisa and thousands of masterpieces.

name: Mount Rushmore
description: A massive sculpture carved into granite, depicting four US presidents.

name: Maldives
description: A tropical paradise of atolls and islands, famous for beaches and luxury resorts.

name: Prague Castle
description: A historic castle complex dating back to the 9th century, overlooking Prague.

name: Great Sphinx of Giza
description: A colossal limestone statue with the body of a lion and the head of a pharaoh.

name: Hallstatt
description: A picturesque lakeside village in the Austrian Alps.

name: Jerusalem Old City
description: A city sacred to Judaism, Christianity, and Islam, rich in history and heritage.

name: Kremlin and Red Square
description: A historic fortified complex and the heart of Russia’s political and cultural life.

name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
description: A freestanding bell tower famous for its unintended tilt.

name: Mecca
description: Islam’s holiest city, home to the Kaaba and destination for Hajj pilgrimage.

name: Uluru (Ayers Rock)
description: A massive sandstone monolith sacred to indigenous Australians.

name: Yosemite National Park
description: A UNESCO site known for granite cliffs, waterfalls, and giant sequoias.

name: Dubai Palm Jumeirah
description: A man-made island shaped like a palm tree, home to luxury resorts.

name: Edinburgh Castle
description: A historic fortress overlooking the city of Edinburgh.

name: Sahara Desert
description: The largest hot desert in the world, stretching across several African countries.

name: Everglades National Park
description: A unique wetland ecosystem home to alligators, birds, and mangroves.
